intro: Mariscus keniensis, commonly known as the Kenyan marshmallow, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it plays a role in local ecosystems and has potential medicinal uses.
